revised_title: The Duration and Timing of Meiosis: A Comprehensive Review
tldr: This article reviews the methods and techniques used to estimate the duration of meiosis and its stages, as well as the experiments conducted to locate the sensitive stages when exposure to various treatments can affect meiotic chromosome behavior. The authors discuss the factors that affect the duration of meiosis, such as environmental factors, nuclear DNA content, ploidy level, and genotype. They also highlight the importance of meiotic timing experiments in understanding the meiotic process and its implications for the organism.
